alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 3:54PM EDT until August 30 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch, Candler, Effingham, Jenkins and Screven. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Allendale, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain associate with Hurricane Idalia over the area. As much as 2 to 5 inches of rain has fallen across the area. The risk for flooding will continue to increase through early this evening as Idalia moves through Southeast Georgia. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Statesboro, Metter, Allendale, Millen, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Butts, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax, Brooklet, Portal, Brunson, Hiltonia, Gifford, Newington, Oliver, Furman and Scotia.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
